name: CS5001 19973 Intensive Foundations of CS
description: Basic principles of rocket propulsion and rocket engines.

lessons.name: Introduction to Rocket Propulsion I
lessons.description: Rocket propulsion is the science of accelerating matter to very high speeds using rockets. The matter, called propellant, is stored in a tank and ejected at high speed through a nozzle. The propellant is ejected at high speed in the opposite direction of the desired rocket motion, as described by Newton's third law of motion.

name: CS5002 19998 Discrete Structures
description: Understanding rocket fuel, combustion processes, and efficiency.

lessons.name: Fuel and Combustion I
lessons.description: Rocket fuel is a material that releases energy when it is burned. The most common type of rocket fuel is liquid hydrogen, which is burned with liquid oxygen to produce water vapor. Other types of rocket fuel include kerosene, methane, and solid propellants.

name: CS5004 36416 Object-Oriented Design Merged
description: Principles of rocket nozzle design and performance optimization.

lessons.name: Nozzle Design I
lessons.description: The nozzle is the part of a rocket engine that converts the energy of the propellant into kinetic energy. The nozzle is designed to accelerate the propellant to a high speed and direct it in the desired direction. The nozzle is designed to accelerate the propellant to a high speed and direct it in the desired direction.

name: CS 5008 Data Str, Algo & App in CmpSys
description: Basic aerodynamic concepts and fluid dynamics principles.

name: CS5200 17402 DATABASE MANAGEMENT SYS SEC 05 FALL 2023 [PTL-2-TR]
description: This course introduces relational database management systems (RDBMS) as a class of software systems and prepares students to be sophisticated users of database management systems.  Covers design theory, query language, and performance/tuning issues. Topics include relational algebra, SQL, stored procedures, user-defined functions, cursors, embedded SQL programs, client-server interfaces, entity-relationship diagrams, normalization, B-trees, concurrency, transactions, database security, constraints, object-relational DBMSs, and specialized engines such as spatial, text, XML conversion, and time series. Includes exercises using a commercial relational or object-relational database management system.

lessons.name: Week0

The propellant is ejected at high speed in the opposite direction of the desired rocket motion, as described by Newton's third law of motion.

name: CS5610 17387 Web Development
description: Study of aerodynamic heating and thermal protection systems.

name: Spacecraft Structural Design
description: Fundamentals of designing spacecraft structures and materials selection.

name: Orbital Mechanics
description: Understanding orbital dynamics and mission planning.

name: Spacecraft Systems Engineering
description: Overview of spacecraft systems and subsystems engineering.
